Description: The renaissance in adoptive cell therapy, heralded by the success of CD19 CAR-T cell therapy, has catalyzed  the development of similar strategies for the treatment of both liquid and solid tumor malignancies. However, challenges arising from regimen-related toxicities, and both T cell-intrinsic and extrinsic factors limiting efficacy and long-term protection, have mitigated broader application of CAR-T and T cell-based therapies, in general. In this session, we learn how discoveries in basic research and innovations in molecular engineering address some of these challenges and re-energize the promise of a cell-based modality for treating more cancers for more patients.
